keyMoments.title: Kin'emon's Torso First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Kin'emon's severed torso appears as a mysterious headless, legless swordsman attacking Brook on the frozen side of Punk Hazard. The torso wields two swords with expert precision despite having no eyes or head.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Kin'emon to the series, albeit in his dismembered state due to Law's powers. Sets up the mystery of the samurai and his eventual reunion with his other body parts.

keyMoments.title: Torso Demonstrates Two-Sword Style
keyMoments.description: The torso reveals it can fight using Two Sword Style, unsheathes a second blade and attacks Brook with remarkable skill.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Kin'emon's exceptional swordsmanship - even separated into pieces, his torso alone is a formidable fighter.

abilities.description: Kin'emon wields two swords simultaneously with expert precision, even when reduced to just a torso.

reveals.information: Expert swordsman capable of fighting with two swords
Body has been dismembered and scattered across Punk Hazard

keyMoments.title: Brook Battles Mysterious Torso Samurai
keyMoments.description: Brook encounters and fights against Kin'emon's headless torso on the frozen side of Punk Hazard, showcasing his swordsmanship skills.
keyMoments.significance: First major combat scene for Brook in the Punk Hazard arc, demonstrating his post-timeskip abilities.
keyMoments.quote: A ghost?! But ghosts don't come out during the day! And besides, I didn't do anything wrong!

name.japanese: トラファルガー・D・ワーテル・ロー

keyMoments.title: Law Revealed as Shichibukai
keyMoments.description: Trafalgar Law appears for the first time since the timeskip, now bearing the title of Shichibukai. He confronts Smoker and the G-5 Marines at Punk Hazard.
keyMoments.significance: First post-timeskip appearance of Law with his new Warlord status, dramatically changing the power dynamics and setting up the eventual Straw Hat-Heart Pirates alliance.
keyMoments.quote: No one is permitted to set foot on this island. What are you doing here, Smoker-ya?

reveals.information: Became one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea during the timeskip by delivering 100 pirate hearts to the World Government
Currently stationed at Punk Hazard, Vegapunk's former laboratory

keyMoments.title: Smoker Infiltrates Punk Hazard
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Smoker leads the G-5 Marines in breaking through the ice barriers and entering Punk Hazard via a hidden river.
keyMoments.significance: Brings the Marines directly into the Punk Hazard conflict, setting up future confrontations with Law and Caesar Clown.

keyMoments.title: Smoker Confronts Law
keyMoments.description: Smoker encounters Trafalgar Law, now a Shichibukai, stationed at Punk Hazard and questions why he's at the forbidden island.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the brewing conflict between Smoker and Law, two powerful figures with different agendas on Punk Hazard.

keyMoments.title: Brownbeard Attacks Luffy's Group
keyMoments.description: Brownbeard and his centaur unit intercept and attack Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Robin at the lake, accusing them of being intruders.
keyMoments.significance: First direct combat between the Straw Hats and Caesar's subordinates on Punk Hazard.
keyMoments.quote: You're intruders! Because of the samurai in your boat!
